intro: [WRONG START] Triodia multinerviosa, commonly known as the spinifex grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, featuring wiry, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It plays a vital role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for native wildlife. Triodia multinerviosa is often found in coastal and inland dunes, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
